history.text: I really liked the characters in the movie.
HI!  I liked the characters too. The characters in this movie are unique.
I really think that the animation is some of the best ive seen.
The animation was wonderful. I am a big fan of animated movies.  I think that the story line was very well written as well
Yeah, the story line is definitely great. I think it's a great take on using animals to reference some of the diversity in today's society
I agree.  And there was just enough humor as well
Yeah, the humor is great. I think it's something both adults and kids can enjoy. Critics seem to like the humor too. And most the general public.
Yes this is a movie that everyone can enjoy! Even people who aren't a big fan of animation. I believe they'd be surprised by how much they enjoyed it if they watched it.
I thought it had a pretty good cast for the voices as well.

I agree. My favorites were
  Gennifer Goodwin as Officer Judy Hopps and Jason Bateman as Nick Wilde
I like the scene where one of the characters use her carrot pen to record a convo.
I liked it when Judy saved Nick by trapping Manchas, then Manchas has vanished when ZPD arrived.
I think that's what makes the movie great. It incorporates comedy and great action scenes.
It definitely did.  I think most critics agree with that as well.
I was able to laugh while sit at the edge of my seat at what was going to happen next.
That's what makes these type of animated films so great. The writers kept   Zootopia light-hearted yet action packed
The part the asylum was used was pretty cool.
It was. I also enjoyed Chief Bogo's character in the movie
I did too. Characters like Mayor Leodore Lionheart were also interesting.
I like that the message in the movie involved over-looking assumptions and stereotypes.
I think these types of messages in movies are great for all.
Definitely. And it was also cool how in a world where animals act like humans, the plot where they start turning into animals is a great twist.

Yes! It was unique. You could see their animal 
qualities as well as human-like qualities.
Part of the interesting aspect of the movie is Judy actually acting like a detective to prove herself.
Yes! Even though she second-guessed herself, she still did it
She was also very smart and cunning.
She was.  I like that she proved herself.
I think it was part of why the character was so empowering to many people.
Definitely. It sends a great message.
